summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant United States Attorneys discussing redaction decisions regarding references to Jeffrey Epstein's memory of an incident, injuries, and safety concerns while in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The discussion centers on whether certain statements should be redacted to avoid revealing details or implications about the incident.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email inquiry about redaction consistency regarding statements made by Jeffrey Epstein about an incident and his safety concerns in the SHU.

events.title: Epstein's statements about incident in SHU
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein made statements about his memory being impaired for an incident involving a neck injury and expressed a desire to remain in a location he considered 'safe' for an entire week while in the Special Housing Unit.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center
keyFacts: The email discusses redacting Jeffrey Epstein's statements about his memory being impaired for an incident due to sleep apnea and a neck injury.
It also discusses redacting Epstein's request to remain in a 'safe' location in the SHU for a week, as it might imply he was attacked.
The correspondence reveals internal DOJ deliberations about what details from Epstein's statements and medical records should be withheld from public release.
The email chain is dated May 2-3, 2021, indicating post-mortem review of case materials.
The discussion references page 2624 of a document and mentions that the same text appears in some medical records.
